message.content:
cs.CR, cs.MM, cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.SI

The paper discusses a new strain of sensor malware that leverages smartphone sensors to steal information from the physical environment. It specifically focuses on the use of the camera sensor to construct 3D models of indoor environments for remote reconnaissance and virtual theft. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). 

The paper also discusses the use of mobile devices as powerful surveillance and virtual theft platforms, which falls under the category of cs.MM (Multimedia). The construction of 3D models using camera sensors involves computer vision techniques, which falls under the category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). 

The paper also discusses the human factors involved in the effectiveness of using mobile devices for surveillance and virtual theft, which falls under the category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Finally, the paper suggests possible defenses against visual malware, which falls under the category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
